snippet: The I.R.S. should have scrutinized every group seeking a tax exemption for “social welfare” activity — Democrat or Republican, conservative or liberal.
abstract: Editorial argues that Internal Revenue Service was absolutely correct to investigate abuse of tax code by political organizations masquerading as 'social welfare' groups, but erred by focusing only on conservative organizations; decries that IRS scandal will distract from more substantial issues like budget, gun control and immigration reform.
lead_paragraph: The I.R.S. should have scrutinized every group seeking a tax exemption for “social welfare” activity — Democrat or Republican, conservative or liberal.

headline.seo: White House Under Fire: It Condemns I.R.S. Audits
headline.print_headline: It Condemns I.R.S. Audits of Political Groups
